intro: Amphirrhox longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved amphirrhox, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
